page.title: 01Downland NW of Chichester
page.content: Attractive, unspoiled, peaceful countryside with valleys, mainly open farmland, running NW to SE, their sides, mostly wooded, rising to ridges of the South downs. Th Petersfield to Chichester road bisects the area and narrow lanes lead to the hamlets of East Marden, North marden and chilgrove. The land supports mixed farming and forestry. Historically interesting are the churches (12/13) of East & North Marden, the thatched wellhead at East Marden, two tumuli and the remains of a medieval village and chapel. Local hostelries are the royal Oak, a traditional "pub" and the White Horse, now more restraunt than pub, with wines of international repute. Local fauna include fallow and row deer, grey squirrels, rabbits, hares, foxes, badgers, pheasant, partrige and owls.
